nodes.name: Missile (Crateria Moat)

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This jump is much easier without HiJump or Speedbooster equipped.

strats.name: Moat Reverse Jump
note: Execution of this strat is non-trivial, and failing will lead to falling into the pit.
Depending on item loadout, that could be a softlock.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: FIXME: This will grab the item and continue the spark to the left door. If this is an E-Tank, Samus will not maintain full Energy after the strat.

strats.name: Moat SpringBall Bounce
strats.note: Open the door and step as close to the transition as possible. Run, jump, lateral midair morph on the way down, then bounce off the pedestal to get to the other side.

strats.name: Moat Continuous Walljump
note: Stand on the farthest pixel into the door possible using moonwalk, X-Ray, or morphball turn around.
Aligning against the closed door shell on the other side of the transition also works if possible and movement speed is not impeded.
Run towards the water and jump on the last possible frame.
Perform the CWJ off of the item pedestal to cross to the other side.

nodes.name: Crateria Kihunter Room Bottom Door (to Elevator)

locks.name: Crateria Kihunter Room Bottom Yellow Lock (to Elevator)

strats.name: Get Hit by Thawing Sciser
note: Run from the ledge into the open doorway while hitting the frozen Crab as it thaws and the door transition simultaneously.
Note that this requires a pixel perfect freeze, a small pixel starting window, and has tight timing. It then has a 50% success rate due to collision oscillation.

strats.name: Base
note: Jump and aim down to lower the camera to see where the crabs are.
Alternatively use a Power Bomb to kill them or risk tanking a hit.

rooms.name: West Ocean
rooms.note: The section between Bowling Alley Path and Bowling Alley is excluded from West Ocean and considered as its own room instead (Homing Geemer Room)

nodes.name: West Ocean Left Door (to Moat)

runways.name: Base Runway - West Ocean Left Door (to Moat)

strats.name: Ocean Floor Shinecharge Left
strats.note: Jump to the Runway connected to the Left side door before sparking.

nodes.name: West Ocean Top Right Door (to Attic)

runways.name: Base Runway - West Ocean Top Right Door (to Attic)

strats.name: West Ocean Top Right Shinecharge With Jump Assist
strats.note: Charge on the below runway and use HiJump to get up quickly.

strats.name: West Ocean: G-Mode Setup Lure Zeb from Below (to Attic)
note: Go down to the Zeb Farm which normally leads to the Bowling Alley Path.
While standing on the right of the Zeb farm, freeze the Zeb while it is still moving up and facing to the right.
Quickly go through the morph tunnel with Bombs or Spring Ball, and get onto the small floating platform just above the Zeb farm.
After the Zeb is visible, freeze it and jump on top of it. Use the Zeb as a platform to climb high enough to get it to be aligned with the door.
Use the background to see how high the Zeb is - Get the Zeb 2-3 tiles higher than the thinner bright line in the background.
Note that if the Zeb is off screen horizontally it will despawn, but if it's off screen vertically it will not.
Chase the Zeb towards the doorway, refreezing it as needed.
strats.devNote: FIXME: This and the other should be converted to a reusable notable, once they are moved into the links section.

nodes.name: West Ocean Middle Right Door (to Bowling Alley Top)

runways.name: Base Runway - West Ocean Middle Right Door (to Bowling Alley Top)

strats.name: West Ocean: G-Mode Setup Lure Zeb from Below (to Bowling Alley Top)
note: Go down to the Zeb Farm which normally leads to the Bowling Alley Path.
While standing on the right of the Zeb farm, freeze the Zeb while it is still moving up and facing to the right.
Quickly go through the morph tunnel with Bombs or Spring Ball, and get onto the small floating platform just above the Zeb farm.
After the Zeb is visible, fall off the platform to make the Zeb move horizontally at the right height to hit Samus in the doorway to the right.
Note that if the Zeb is off screen horizontally it will despawn, but if it's off screen vertically it will not.
strats.devNote: FIXME: This and the other should be converted to a reusable notable, once they are moved into the links section.

nodes.name: West Ocean Middle Right Door (from Gravity Suit Room)

runways.name: Base Runway - West Ocean Middle Right Door (from Gravity Suit Room)

strats.name: West Ocean Floor Fast Wallclimb to Gravity Door
strats.note: Use walljumps to climb from the ocean floor up to the gravity suit room door.

strats.name: West Ocean Floor Fast Spacejump Wallclimb to Gravity Door
strats.note: Spacejump out of the water then use walljumps up to the gravity suit room door.

locks.name: West Ocean Ship Exit Grey Lock (to Gravity Suit Room)

bypassStrats.name: Bowling Skip
note: 1- Grapple on a ripper to get position inside the wall under the door.
2- Do a Crystal Flash to force a standup.
3- X-Ray climb up to the door trigger.
bypassStrats.devNote: TODO: There may be Bob strats to skip the crystal flash requirement.

nodes.name: West Ocean Center Right Door (to Bowling Alley Path)

runways.name: Base Runway - West Ocean Center Right Door (to Bowling Alley Path)

strats.name: West Ocean Morph Tunnel Rush
note: Preopen the door and shotblock, then go back and charge a shinespark.
Springball through the short morphball tunnel to just have enough time to shinespark out the door.

obstacles.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs by PBing Item: Return or Risk Loss of Access

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 2 screens.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 2 screens.

devNote: It's possible to stop half-way by shooting open the door that appears to lead to Bowling Alley
This has limited usefulness, because this door actually leads to the same transition as the bottom right door (to the Wrecked Ship Entrance).
Likewise the door on the left, which appears to lead to Bowling Alley Path, actually leads to the same transition as the bottom left door (to the Moat).
There is a potential application by using this runway to the right, as it is longer than the one in front of the bottom right door.
FIXME: add nodes to represent the doors that appear to lead left and right to Bowling Alley Path and Bowling Alley, and add a similar strat leading there.

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 3 screens.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 3 screens.

strats.name: Health Conscious Shinespark
strats.note: Jump to the submerged platform, then jump again.

strats.name: West Ocean Grapple Fling
strats.note: Attach to the ripper when it is all the way left.  Build momentum and launch Heavensward.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The shot blocks can be destroyed without using bombs

strats.name: X-Ray Standup
strats.note: Unmorph and shoot the shot block, then x-ray standup, partial floor clip, and down grab to escape.

strats.name: West Ocean Bug Boost with Ice
note: Get a Zeb to move left into the morph passage, and reach the end of the tunnel before it.
Freeze the bug at the correct height, such that it will move and be able to hit Samus while in the morph tunnel.
While in the first two-tile tall region, shoot and refreeze the bug. Then go to the second two-tile region and shoot the block.
Return and lure the bug such that it hits Samus and boosts her up and onto the ledge to escape.
Be careful not to despawn the enemy by moving it off camera, except while it is frozen. This strat is a one-shot try and failure is a softlock.

strats.name: West Ocean Bug Boost with Wave or Spazer
note: Get a Zeb to move left into the morph passage, and reach the end of the tunnel before it.
Shoot the block with Wave or while crouching with Spazer before luring the bug.
Quickly lure the bug then use a mockball on the 4 tile floor before the tunnel.
This strat is a one-shot try and failure is a softlock.

strats.name: West Ocean Bug Boost
note: Get a Zeb to move left into the morph passage, and reach the end of the tunnel before it.
Must be quick enough to shoot the shot block first. Requires a mockball on the 4 tile floor before the tunnel.
This strat is a one-shot try and failure is a softlock.

strats.name: West Ocean Bug Ice Clip
note: Freeze a bug three tiles to the right of the morph tunnel entrance, directly under the tile where ceiling is higher.
Jump onto the bug, crouch, and jump up.
The bug must be at a very precise pixel height unless using  XRay and Morph.
Note that although the ceiling here is 3 tiles thick, only the bottom tile is solid; the other two are slopes pushing Samus up, allowing the trick to be done.

strats.name: G-mode Morph X-Ray Standup
strats.note: Unmorph and cancel g-mode, shoot the shot block, then x-ray standup, partial floor clip, and down grab to the ledge. Wiggle to escape.

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: This is to return below if using g-mode strats, to avoid canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess.

strats.name: Camera Maniuplation
note: Crouch and shoot the shot blocks from afar. There is enough time to get past them without Gravity before they respawn.
If the shot blocks do not break, roll all the way to the left to reset the camera, then go back.

strats.name: Climb the Trippers Bootless
note: Jump on the left platforms to get the middle Tripper on screen, luring it to the right.
Get on the middle Tripper and use it to jump to the item. This requires a somewhat precise shot and jump, particularly if the top Tripper is in the way.
The jump and shot can be easier and done at the apex of a single jump starting with a crouch. Freezing the Trippers can make this much easier.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The super block respawns.
devNote: This obstacle is to represent shooting the super block and is only used in quickly returning after grabbing the item.
It is necessary because there is a g-mode strat to get to 14.

strats.name: West Ocean Platforming
strats.note: It may be best to have shorter, later jumps to prevent bonking the ceiling or hitting the Ripper.

strats.name: Gravity Suit
strats.devNote: A speedy jump would be obsoleted by another strat for being tricky.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The super block respawns.

strats.name: Beat West Ocean Super Block Respawn
strats.note: It's possible to go down, grab the item, and return before the Super block respawns, if going quick enough.

strats.name: G-mode Overload PLMs by Bombing Crumble Block with Space Jump
strats.note: The crumble block is the leftmost flat ceiling tile.

strats.name: G-mode Overload PLMs by Bombing Crumble Block
strats.note: Start the IBJ on the second downward tile from the door. The crumble block is the leftmost flat ceiling tile.
strats.devNote: Without canCeilingBombJump, this would take more than 10 minutes.

strats.name: West Ocean G-mode Overload PLMs by PBing Missile Item
note: To overload the PLMs, place a PB precisely to the right of the bottom of the second overhang above the door to the Moat.
This is at the max jump height without HiJump. Placing the PB higher or lower will not overload the PLMs without many PBs.
strats.devNote: This link is used to get the item and return, so there is no canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess.

strats.name: West Ocean G-mode Overload PLMs by PBing Missile Item Softlock Risk
note: To overload the PLMs, place a PB precisely to the right of the bottom of the second overhang above the door to the Moat.
This is at the max jump height without HiJump. Placing the PB higher or lower will not overload the PLMs without many PBs.

nodes.name: East Ocean Left Door (to Electric Death)

runways.name: Base Runway - East Ocean Left Door (to Electric Death)

strats.name: East Ocean Floor Shinecharge Left
strats.note: Quickly climb the submerged structures.  Not dashing may make platforming easier.

nodes.name: East Ocean Right Door (to Kago Room)

runways.name: Base Runway - East Ocean Right Door (to Kago Room)

strats.name: East Ocean Floor Jump Assist Shinecharge Right
East Ocean Floor Walljump Shinecharge Right

nodes.name: East Ocean Junction (Left side Pit)
East Ocean Junction (Right side Pit)

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: East Ocean Shinespark Water Escape With Lower Choot Alive
note: Enter the room while building a shinespark and use it on the lowest part of the ramp to diagonally spark up and out of the water.
The timing and positioning for the Shinespark are very precise, and there are no extra frames on the Shinespark timer to work with.

Carry the shinespark to the bottom of the ramp either with a bounce ball which takes damage from the Choot, with a late mockball that does not have time to decellerate, or with very precise spacejumps.
Then shinespark up and use SpaceJump to reach the door.

strats.name: Speedy Springball Jump and SpaceJump
note: Run for 7 tiles for enough speed to springball from the submerged platform up to the platform enemy, above the water.
Turning on SpeedBooster midjump, after running 7+ tiles, will automatically hit the run speed requirement.
It is not necessary to enter the water to clear the rightmost Choot.

strats.name: East Ocean Springball Bounce to the Door with SpaceJump
note: Build up run speed and then use controlled springball bounces to cross the ocean to the far right ledge, and then use SpaceJump to reach the door.
Mockball down the submerged ramp and begin SpringBall bouncing under water using the platforms.
Disable SpringBall after the final jump once Samus starts falling again as a way to gain extra speed.

strats.name: East Ocean Speedy Springball Bounce to the Door
note: Using an exact runway size of 7 tiles; use extremely precise, controlled springball bounces to cross the ocean.
7 tiles of runspeed can freely be achieved by requipping SpeedBooster after reaching the max normal run speed.
Mockball down the submerged ramp and begin SpringBall bouncing either above the water, or under water using the platforms.
The final SpringBall bounce must be on the left edge of the rightmost underwater platform.
While the bounce is occuring, setup a mid-air SpringBall Jump to escape the water and reach the door.

strats.name: Full Room Shinespark Plus SpaceJump
note: Enter the room while building a shinespark and use it on the lowest part of the ramp to cross the room and reach a raised ledge on the right side wall.
From there, use SpaceJump to escape the water.
Carry the shinespark to the bottom of the ramp by delaying the first Choot with two Power Beam shots, killing it, or bounceballing through it.
The Choot can be shot diagonally from the middle platform, and again by running off that platform and aiming down to float above it.

strats.name: East Ocean Shinespark Water Escape
note: Enter the room while building a shinespark and use it on the lowest part of the ramp to diagonally spark up and out of the water.
Use very low jump height space jumps to carry momentum to the far side of the submerged ramp.
Both Choots must be killed.
Using Screw Attack: stay a little bit high in the water so that it remains active for the second Choot.
Using Plasma or ammo: kill the first Choot while running down the middle platform, and the second while gliding above it after spacejumping through the water.
Then shinespark up and use SpaceJump to reach the door.

strats.name: East Ocean Shinespark Water Escape With Lower Choot Alive (Morph)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: East Ocean Shinespark Water Escape With Lower Choot Alive
note: Enter the room while building a shinespark and use it on the lowest part of the ramp to diagonally spark up and out of the water.
Unmorphing with the correct timing and positioning for the Shinespark are very precise, and there are no extra frames on the Shinespark timer to work with.
Carry the shinespark to the bottom of the ramp either with a bounce ball which takes damage from the Choot, or delay the first Choot with two shots and then use a late mockball.
Then shinespark up and use SpaceJump to reach the door.

strats.name: East Ocean Shinespark Water Escape With Lower Choot Alive (Ice Wave Spazer)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: East Ocean Shinespark Water Escape With Lower Choot Alive
note: Enter the room while building a shinespark and use it on the lowest part of the ramp to diagonally spark up and out of the water.
Use very low jump height space jumps to carry momentum to the far side of the submerged ramp.
Freeze the first Choot from the middle platform.
Either SpaceJump just right so as to pass above the second Choot, or freeze it as it touches Samus to pass through without losing speed.
Then shinespark up and use SpaceJump to reach the door.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Horizontally shinespark from the grassy patch on the ledge near the door, then jump across the platforms.

strats.name: Suitless with SpringBall Jump Mid Air
East Ocean Suitless Damage Boost Water Escape
strats.note: Find the Choot that is closest to the surface of the water, crouch jump under it and damage boost onto the dry platform to the left.

strats.name: East Ocean Space Jump Water Escape with Ice and XRay Standup
note: Freeze the right-most ramp Choot in a way where Samus can climb on top of it and use Space Jump to escape the water.
Use a turn around to avoid knockback when making contact with the Choot to better time the use of Ice.
Freeze the Choot as far to the right (on its lowest swoop), but this method is less precise than the alternatives.
If Samus is inside the Choot when it is frozen, she can continuing moving freely.
Jump on top either in spinjump or in Morph Ball
Use XRay to standup, clipping partially into the above slope.
Use a flately jump to fall out of the wall while still keeping enough height to spacejump on top of the water and escape.

strats.name: East Ocean Space Jump Water Escape with Ice (Left to Right)
note: Get to the right of the Choot on the rightmost platform. Spin jump up to the right, break spin while aligned with the wall, then freeze the Choot and stand on it while it is midair to the right of the stalagmite.
Jump from the Choot to the water line and space jump at the water line to the Kamer platform.

strats.name: East Ocean Space Jump Water Escape (Left to Right)
note: Standing from the rightmost platform, jump to the right of the stalagmite. Perform a midair wiggle to get to the left to the stalagmite, then precisely wall jump off of it.
Then perform a frame perfect space jump at the water line to bounce on the water over to the Kamer platform.

strats.name: Suitless with SpringBall Jump Mid Air
Suitless Frozen Choot, Spring Ball, Space Jump
note: Freeze the Choot at the top right of its jump. Quickly get on top of it by first getting onto the pillar to the left.
Perform a precise spring ball jump to get to the far right ledge, while avoiding hitting the water surface.
While on the ledge, stand on the raised ground to the right and jump to the surface, then space jump across the water to the left.

strats.name: Suitless with SpringBall Jump Mid Air
East Ocean Suitless Damage Boost Underwater Pillar
strats.note: Crouch jump down grab to get over the first two pillars. Crouch jump damage boost on the Skultera then down grab to get over the third.

nodes.name: Forgotten Highway Kago Room Bottom Door (to Crab Maze)
Crab Maze Top Door (to Kago Room)

strats.name: Frozen Sciser
note: The nearby Global crab can be used to exit on the left side of the door.
Exiting on the right will require travelling the Morph maze to find a local crab or two.
devNote: There is a Morphless way to jump on the crab with aim down but it feels too precise to include.
Global Crab (left side) takes 40 seconds, local crab (Right side) is 180.  Finding two left side crabs to use together is faster.

nodes.name: Crab Maze Middle Junction
nodes.note: Exists mainly to separate node 2 from the shot block.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: Without Springball or Gravity, it is possible to overload PLMs with the crumble blocks with bombs.
Take the first left above the waterline. Place bombs in the single tile nook on the left.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph to overload Crumble Block Plms
note: Place bombs at the far right, next to the low underwater ceiling.
To safely bomb the fast crab, wait just left of the crack on the floor where it falls.
